definition: to observe a moment of silence in tribute
silent/to write from memory
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]
sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole

sentences.english: They stood in silent homage round her grave.
sentences.chinese: 他們站立在她的墓的周圍向她默哀。

sentences.english: As in years past, the ceremony included four moments of silence.
sentences.chinese: 如同過去幾年一樣，儀式有四次默哀。

sentences.english: A minute of silence was observed for the quake victims before the run.
sentences.chinese: 起跑前，全體與會者向汶川大地震遇難者默哀一分鐘。

sentences.english: The Moscow city government declared Tuesday would be a day of mourning.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科市政府宣佈週二爲默哀日。

sentences.english: The Assembly observed a two-minute silence.
At 2:28 pm, Chinese people nationwide stood in silence for 3 minutes to mourn the victims with air sirens, car and bus horns wailing in grief.
sentences.chinese: 14時28分，全國人民集體肅立默哀3分鐘。

sentences.english: Any non-local employees who would like to join the mourning ceremony are warmly welcomed.
sentences.chinese: 對於願意參加默哀儀式的外籍員工，我們深表感謝。

sentences.english: At 9:03, silence again when the second plan hit the south tower.
sentences.chinese: 早上9點03分，再次默哀，紀念第二個擊中南樓。

sentences.english: Chunmei's sister and brother to the grave Chunling silence to her husband.
sentences.chinese: 春梅的妹妹春玲和弟弟到墓前向姐夫默哀。

sentences.english: The president and his wife Michelle stood heads bowed on the South Lawn of the White House.
sentences.chinese: 總統夫婦走出白宮，步上南坪並垂首而立，肅穆默哀。

sentences.english: After the first moment of silence, at 8:46 a.m., they began filtering into the plaza.
sentences.chinese: 上午8:46，默哀之後，他們進入了廣場。

sentences.english: China has also suspended the Olympic torch relay during the three-day mourning period.
sentences.chinese: 默哀期間，股市停盤，奧運聖火也停止傳遞三天。

sentences.english: Mr Tung led the audience and his cabinet in one minute of silence.
sentences.chinese: 董建華帶領觀衆和高官默哀一分鐘。

definition: to express grief/to mourn
to grieve over sb's death/to lament sb's death/mourning
to pay respects to the dead/to mark sb's passing
victim of an accident/casualty/martyr for one's country
to grieve
to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
grief-stricken thoughts/mourning
to die in an accident/to die for a just cause
Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
half-mast/half-staff
grief/remorse/deep in sorrow/bitter (anguish)/profound (condolences)
victim/fatality
to hoot/to whistle
